data.title: Soft wrap setting does not affect soft wrap when new file is opened
data.body:
I've been having this problem for a while and I just `rm -rf`'ed Atom.app and `~/.atom` then installed fresh from a new download from the atom website. It still has this problem:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5728307/8814127/097705a0-2fbe-11e5-898f-ca44b30ee84b.png)

In both checked and unchecked positions of this checkbox, new documents I open still have soft wrap on by default. Even after I restart it, it still has this problem of not following the settings by default.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'text' of undefined
data.body:
The app crashed while trying to open a file. I force closed it and re-opened it.

This has also happened on a normal close and re-open.

[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Open Atom.

**Atom Version**: 1.0.2
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.4
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'text' of undefined

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/display-buffer.js:1655

TypeError: Cannot read property 'text' of undefined
    at DisplayBuffer.module.exports.DisplayBuffer.findMaxLineLength (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/display-buffer.js:1655:28)
    at DisplayBuffer.module.exports.DisplayBuffer.updateScreenLines (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/display-buffer.js:1552:12)
    at DisplayBuffer.module.exports.DisplayBuffer.handleTokenizedBufferChange (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/display-buffer.js:1525:12)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/display-buffer.js:5:61
    at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:82:11)
    at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.tokenizeNextChunk (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:320:22)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/tokenized-buffer.js:271:26
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/underscore-plus/node_modules/underscore/underscore.js:666:47
```
### Commands

```
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "projectHome": "/Users/khudson/code",
    "ignoredNames": [
      ".git",
      ".pyc",
      ".DS-STORE"
    ],
    "audioBeep": false
  },
  "editor": {
    "invisibles": {},
    "scrollPastEnd": true,
    "preferredLineLength": 120,
    "showIndentGuide": true,
    "softWrapAtPreferredLineLength": true,
    "softWrapHangingIndent": 2,
    "zoomFontWhenCtrlScrolling": true,
    "fontSize": 12
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
language-jade, v0.5.1
linter-pep8, v1.0.0
linter-pylint, v0.2.2
restore-windows, v0.4.1

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Auto-indent on newline broken in 1.0.2
data.body:
Auto-indent on newline works in 1.0.1 but is broken in 1.0.2.

To test, I'm opening a new file (Command-N) and typing a line that starts with a tab. When I press return I expect the next line to have the same indentation. The behaviour is as expected on 1.0.1 but there is no indentation on the next line in 1.0.2.

I tested the behaviour by installing 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 packages from https://github.com/atom/atom/releases. I'm using Mac OSX Yosemite and vanilla installs of Atom with no third party plugins.

Cheers,

Martin

data.title: One PackageManager::activate() spec fails due to local ~/.atom/styles.less file
data.body:
_(See https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5763#issuecomment-123460390 for more context)_

Running `apm test` from the root directory of a local clone causes the following spec to fail if `~/.atom/styles.less` exists:

```
PackageManager
  ::activate()
    it calls callbacks registered with ::onDidActivateInitialPackages
      Error: Leaking subscriptions for paths: /Users/izuzak/.atom/styles.less
        at ensureNoPathSubscriptions (/Users/izuzak/github/atom/spec/spec-helper.coffee:194:15)
        at [object Object].<anonymous> (/Users/izuzak/github/atom/spec/spec-helper.coffee:187:3)
```

If the file doesn't exist, the spec doesn't fail.

cc @kevinsawicki

data.title: Typing cursor disappearing on Windows 8/8.1
data.body: When you're typing and press the Windows key on Windows 8/8.1 and then ESC to get back to Atom, the typing cursor is gone =( It comes back if we change typing focus away from it than back. Annoying as heck =/

data.title: Default maintainHistory marker option to false
data.body:
This is a change I've been meaning to make for a while. I made `find-and-replace` and `spell-check` explicitly opt out of marker snapshotting, but in other situations where there are lots of markers (e.g. the linter w/ lots of errors, a big file w/ lots of folds) the marker snapshotting causes noticeable lag.
#### Before

In a 2000-line file w/ 150 folds, `MarkerStore::createSnapshot` takes a long time before and after each change. This character insertion **took 15 ms**.

![screen shot 2015-07-21 at 2 43 16 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/326587/8813331/7fdf8034-2fb7-11e5-977e-00bd087a21de.png)
#### After

Now that part of the flame graph is gone, because folds aren't snapshotted. Folds shouldn't be snapshotted, because they are destroyed if touched by a change anyway. The same character insertion **took 4 ms**.

![screen shot 2015-07-21 at 2 43 33 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/326587/8813377/efa24f96-2fb7-11e5-9704-fa86a21b4abf.png)

data.title: Change Document Polling from Time Interval to Event
data.body:
:pear: ing with @nathansobo 

Previously document polling happened through timed intervals causing continued use of CPU when the editor was unfocused. 

This PR changes the polling to occur when the DOM is mutated or the window is resized (since that doesn't fall under a DOM mutation). Additionally it changes the way Atom updates the CSS so that it occurs as a mutation and the event is captured. Furthermore! It prevents the cursor from ever starting to blink if it wasn't blinking already which can be caused, for instance, when content is changed in the Settings View.

We've added test coverage but are still testing this branch out to be sure we've:
- covered all the DOM changing scenarios
- not added additional CPU usage when editor _is_ active

cc @atom/feedback, try out this branch too if ya can :+1: 

Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4019
Quality Initiative https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7995

data.title: DisplayMarker doesn't dispatch a change event when a line gets wrapped
data.body:
Here's a demonstration: 

![marker-change](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/247140/8806074/2f921bfa-2fd5-11e5-98a6-4a66b857ac5a.gif)

I've attached a listener to the change event of a marker created using `TextEditor::markBufferRange`. As you can see in the console, I do receive the event when adding/removing lines but not when the line I'm editing gets wrapped.

As the range of the underlying buffer marker did not change, it doesn't emit a change event. But the screen range of the display marker did change, so I believe it should emit an event on its own in this case.

data.body: Can we get the text editor to show emoji (the Unicode symbols more specifically, not markdown emoji) as images? I didn't see a plugin for it...

data.body: ive come across this several times now. but when checking to see if something is be used in activity monitor, such as haxe or similar. i have spotted this error. screenshot is given. now, i am not doing anything strange in particular. im working with the haxe packages, plus some others. also my own theme. im running/building the application from within atom itself, but can tfind what is causing this. just that i end up seeing mountains of memory being used with this error

data.title: invisible character settings are removed after first open
data.body:
I just installed Atom on my new work computer for the first time and opened the settings. I noticed there were a few options for setting invisible characters, such as **Cr, Eol, Tab,** etc. This was surprising to me since I did not see those settings for Atom installed on my home computer. I checked to make sure both versions were the latest, which they were. I decided not to worry about it for the time being…

Then after quitting and reopening Atom on my new computer, the character settings were gone! I still have "Show Indent Guide" and "Show Invisibles" but no options to choose invisible characters.

Is this a bug?

---

stats:
- Work Computer: MacBook Pro (Retina, 13-inch, Early 2013), 3 GHz Intel Core i7, OS X 10.10.4 (Yosemite) 
- Home Computer: MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Mid 2014), 2.2 GHz Intel Core i7, Os X 10.10.4 (Yosemite)

data.title: Cant browse file if password is not saved in server config
data.body: If I dont save the password but leave the field blank, it ask me for the password to establish the connection. It say connection ok, but I cant browse the folders. If I store the password on the ftp or sftp connection I get the list of files and all works good. Did I miss something when the password field is blank or it's a bug ?

data.title: Yet another (small) tweak to enable another indentation use case
data.body:
By moving down the line that checks if the `precedingRow` is empty, you will still be able to use the `increaseIndentPattern` and `decreaseNextIndentPattern` to influence your indentation.

Now it seems a little weird to me to have a `decreaseNextIndentPattern` match an empty line and by that make the next line decrease it's indent level, but it seems some language packages (tried to) do exactly that before #6808 with the `decreaseIndentPattern`.

While this could have worked for some, IMO it only worked because of the logic error/problem that was changed/fixed in #6808.

So this change enables such a use case again, and even in a much more predicable and exact way. And of course it's also true that if the empty line does _not_ match the `increaseIndentPattern` or `decreaseNextIndentPattern` (which will be the case in most cases) this change will have no effect except for the fact that the also the empty line is now also matched against the regexp's.

As for the tests... I didn't add any new ones for this use case because currently no language package is using this. The issue https://github.com/atom-haskell/language-haskell/issues/40 and some discussion on Gitter lead me to this change/fix as it seems at least the `langange-haskell` package would like to use it. But until (if) they actually do, I cannot write a test for this I think... All existing tests do still pass and I worked with it for a day now and didn't notice any side effects...

data.title: Please give us discrete options how to deal with indentation
data.body:
As it stands Atom is using "auto-detection" to decide if it should use tabs or spaces to indent and then how many.
That can break in edge cases and if it does it's usually polluting code in unexpected ways.

Please give us an option like you did with character encoding, integrated into the status bar like so many other professional editors do.

That way we can say: This file is using 4 spaces to indent exclusively, period. No matter what happened somewhere else in the file.

data.title: [Feature request]: Auto 'find' highlighted/selected text
data.body: Just as the title suggest, using the 'find' feature to find and highlight/'box' other like mentions within the editor tab of selected text, but without opening the 'find' box/window. This type of functionality seems to be standard in most text editors these days, such as sublime text.

data.title: Auto hide menu bar setting not working properly
data.body:
When initially enabling this option, the menu bar does indeed hide, and hitting the **ALT** key does toggle it showing/hiding.

The problem occurs when you have files open and you want to show the menu bar. Pressing **ALT** doesn't do anything, until you close all your open files and only then does the ALT key show the menu.

If you have the settings tab open, clicking on it will let the **ALT** key show the menu. But then clicking on any other open tab pressing the **ALT** key doesn't make the menu appear.

The attached GIF shows it in action. While I have the .htaccess tab in focus (or any file for that matter) I'm pressing the **ALT** key but nothing is happening.

I'm running Windows 8.1 (64), Atom v1.0.2. This is only a recent phenomena, I think (though could be wrong) it only started happening with the 1.0 release.
## How to reproduce the bug

1) Go to **Settings** and enable **Auto hide menu bar**.
2) Close the **Settings** page.
3) Open a file.
4) Click on the tab for the file you just opened.
5) Press the **TAB** key (the menu will **not** show).
6) Close the file you have open.
7) Press the **TAB** key again (the menu **will** show).
## Where I've seen this bug

Two different workstations, at home and at the office:

1)  On Windows 8.1 (64) running Atom v1.0.2 (home)
2)  On Windows 8.1 (64) running Atom v1.0.2 (at the office)

![auto-hide-menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5625353/8791236/d7dec4ac-2f8a-11e5-8792-37e1de1807bf.gif)

data.title: The Quality Initiative
data.body:
The Atom team will be focusing on quality for the next month or so. This effort is timeboxed: the plan is to finish around the **beginning of Sept**. This means **we probably won't get everything done on this list** during the allotted time window. After this time window, unfinished things will work into our normal issue handling routine.
### What does this mean?

The goal of the quality initiative is to focus on fixing bugs and adding features that impact a lot of people, but are reasonably low effort. Why? There are a lot of low effort things affecting many people, and a lot of issues that slipped through the cracks while we were focused on the API and 1.0. We're just giving our selves some time to focus on them.

These will be small projects, ideally 1-2 days max. We will avoid rewrites or major refactoring.

The quality initiative will be our main focus, but we will still handle issues and review PRs—think of this effort as our 80% time.
### What about X bug/feature?

After this quality initiative, we plan on shifting our 80% time to focus on things like [performance](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/307), better support for [international users](https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/37), and some features we have in mind.

If you know of a bug or feature that is high-impact / low-effort, not in the list below, and does not fall under performance or internationalization, comment on this issue and we'll figure out if it fits in.
### Core
#### Bug
- [ ] Fix largest uncaught errors in bugsnag
- [ ] Continue fixing uncaught errors from https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7740
  - [x] Cannot read property 'dispose' of undefined https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/183
  - [x] Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'isEmpty' of undefined https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/issues/102
- [x] Fix erasing files when no disk space 
  - [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3158 @nathansobo
- [ ] Fix app auto-update issues
  - [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7833
  - [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6612
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7854
  - [ ] better feedback https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8038
- [ ] Fix app update and release notes issues
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5692
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6922
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3757
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6482
- [ ] Investigate issues when changing branches
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4982
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6210
- [x] Cannot open files or folders on Mac OS X El Capitan beta https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7811 (:heart: :apple:)
  - Likely fixed with upgrade to latest atom shell
- [ ] Text editor interaction problems
  - [ ] Line up/down with multiple selections is broken https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2470
  - [ ] Beeping when using ctrl-cmd-down
    - @zcbenz? https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1669
  - [x] ctrl + up/down inserts  or  https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6949
  - [x] scrolling behavior while mouse-selecting whole lines of text is hard to control https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6675 @nathansobo (PR #8123)
  - [ ] Selecting text with option + shift + arrow behaves differently to other Mac apps https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6485
  - [x] Undo of actions taken by package results in corrupted display of buffer https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7516
  - [x] Undo/redo doesn't change cursor position after multiple block edit https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8178 - @maxbrunsfeld
  - [x] Clicking and dragging up in gutter does not scroll https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2696
  - [x] Page Up and Page Down don't move correctly with the window. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8320
  - [x] Multi line mouse select breaks in text editor when editor is small enough https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8539 @nathansobo
  - [x] Strange selection problem https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8369
  - [ ] Overlay items flicker when near the edge of the window https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8295
  - [ ] Shrink or scroll editor when panels at bottom open up https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/8068
  - [x] cmd-l in multi-line selection doesn't select beginning of first line  https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3624
- [x] Keybinding Issues
  - [x] Bundled prefixed keys bindings delay even if 'unset!' by user keymap https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/78
  - [x] Arpeggio key bindings (all these are related):
    - [x] https://github.com/atom/vim-mode/issues/221
    - [x] https://github.com/atom/vim-mode/issues/334
    - [x] https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/17
- [ ] Rendering issues
  - [x] Showing line numbers disables sub-pixel AA on tabs, status-bar etc. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7904
  - [ ] Thin or small fonts rendered on Windows appear colorfully blurry. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7261
- [ ] Window state
  - [ ] Reloading on an external monitor moves the window back to the primary monitor https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6268
- [x] Open a file at a specific line https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7342
#### Feature
- [x] Upgrade to latest electron:
  - [x] https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/7877
  - [x] Fixes rendering issues? https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4924
- [ ] Crash recovery: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4161 @nathansobo
- [x] Line endings config option https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2822 @jlord @maxbrunsfeld
- [x] editor.tabType setting https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3719 @benogle PR: https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/8356
- [x] Make file type -> language mapping locally configurable https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1718 @maxbrunsfeld
- [x] Minimize DOM polling to improve idle battery life https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4019 @nathansobo @jlord
- [x] Remove deprecated code https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5164
- [ ] Do something about metrics visibiliity https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4966
- [x] Async services https://github.com/atom/service-hub/issues/7
- [ ] Improve auto-indentation
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5473
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6655
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/labels/auto-indent
- [ ] Autosave untitled buffers https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/942
- [ ] Ctrl-tab to be MRU: https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/17
- [ ] "Save" or "Save All" on unmodified, opened files results in "Unable to save file: permission denied" error
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7566
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2871
- [ ] Make preview-tabs really good https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/170
### Atom.io
- [ ] Docs for 1.0.5 and 1.0.6 are not shown https://github.com/atom/docs/issues/111
- [ ] Make it low or no maintenance
- [ ] atom:// url package installation
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5262
  - [x] https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/436
- [ ] flight manual apparently has a lot of small bugs:
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/docs/issues/94
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/docs/issues/85
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/docs/issues/81
  - [ ] https://github.com/atom/docs/issues/74
### Packages
#### Find and Replace
- [x] handling path negation https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/149
  - PR https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/8071
- [x] Project replace undo (just add an alert)
- [x] Performance in large files (just dont auto-add markers when over some large amt of results) https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/174
  - Added a min length setting before live searching https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/469
  - There arent really any other quick wins. After this initiative, we will just make it faster.
- [x] Make cmd-d more consistent. Everyone thinks this is a bug https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/482
  - [x] Maybe this: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6800#issuecomment-121976136
  - [x] https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/340

  - [x] https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/356
  - [x] https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/450
- [x] Find settings are not shared between project find and buffer find https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/issues/431
  - https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/475
- [x] Finish muan's sort PR https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/320
#### Settings View
- [ ] Better loadPackages system; keep cache of packages on system, all views use this cache https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/633
- [ ] Better loadOutdated system; keep cache of outdated packages https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/632
  - [ ] Fix: https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/409
- [x] Updating a disabled package automatically re-enables that package https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/603
- [ ] Bug fixing pass
- [x] Render setting description links as links https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/618
#### Autocomplete
- [x] CSS
  - [x] Pops up in non-ideal situations
    - [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-css/issues/15
    - [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-css/issues/18
    - [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-css/issues/20
    - [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-css/issues/21
    - [x] https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/issues/513
  - [x] SASS support https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-css/pull/13
- [x] Actually for real fix html escaping: https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/issues/536
- [x] Figure out something nice for the core keymap issues https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/pull/543
  - https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/issues/319
- [x] Page up/down
  - https://github.com/atom/autocomplete-plus/issues/503
#### Fuzzy Finder
- [ ] Take a pass at indexing, maybe use scandal
  - https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/112
  - https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/88
  - https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/53
  - https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/30
- [ ] 100% CPU usage when started in the home folder https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6437
#### Bracket Matcher
- [ ] Surrounding multiple words with ` characters is broken https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6940
### Modules
- [ ] Improve fuzzaldrin
  - https://github.com/atom/fuzzaldrin/issues/20
  - https://github.com/atom/fuzzaldrin/pull/22
### Pull requests to review
- [x] Babel safeguard https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/8182
- [x] Makefile grammar improvement https://github.com/atom/language-make/pull/17
- [x] Referencing patterns in other grammars https://github.com/atom/first-mate/pull/53
- [x] Resizing tree view with other panels https://github.com/atom/tree-view/pull/534
- [x] Copy selection command https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/8025
- [ ] Infinite loop in parser https://github.com/atom/first-mate/pull/47
- [x] Resize panes with keyboard https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/7354
- [x] Clean up classes when switching themes https://github.com/atom/one-dark-ui/pull/87
- [ ] #{} interpolation improvement https://github.com/atom/bracket-matcher/pull/161
- [ ] Enum description in config https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/7916 and https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/589
- [x] Collapsing sections in settings view: https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/593

data.title: C++ syntax highlighting does not behave properly in some class inheritance cases
data.body: The commented screenshot shows expected and observed behavior. This occurred on OS X. I am running 10.11 Beta, but I'm confident I've experienced this behavior in 10.10 as well.

data.title: binding "alt-'" does not work
data.body:
OS: Arch-Linux x64 (kde)
version: 1.0.2 https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/atom-editor-bin/

When i try to bind to "alt-'" it shows up in the keybindings menu but does not function.
however "ctrl-'" does work (both in the menu and the binding actually works.

For clarification, I am using a fairly obscure keyboard layout (programmer-dvorak) 
In my layout, the ' is where z is in qwerty. So I would like to bind
"alt-'": 'core:undo' **or** 'alt-\'': 'core:undo

but that does not work. As in pressing the keys does not actually undo

"ctrl-'": 'core:undo' **and** 'ctrl-\'': 'core:undo'
both work. As in pressing the keys does actually undo

I also tried binding it to other commands
'ctrl-\'': 'command-palette:toggle' 
does not work

I also tried changing keyboard layouts, and in qwerty I could not seem to make the binding work either.

My unsubstantiated theory is something is not properly reading the ' character even when escaped.

data.title: atom requires sudo
data.body:
I recently installed atom from source.
I did 
`sudo script/build`
`sudo script/grunt install`

When I type `atom` in the terminal, I see this.

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5905966/8783883/4d9b9412-2f3c-11e5-8a3b-20232dc4d2cc.png)

The ownership of the `.atom` directory is this:

![ownership](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5905966/8783903/749880de-2f3c-11e5-8452-031e191046af.png)

Is this the expected behaviour?

data.title: Opening a png image via keyboard shortcuts breaks tab/treeview keyboard navigation
data.body:
1. Use treeview to browse to a png file
2. Hit enter to open and view png file
3. Note that you can no longer user Ctrl-0 to return focus to treeview, and Ctrl-tab to switch tabs until you click on another file in treeview to open it, or another tab. Then it works again.

If the image was opened previously, and you select it again in treeview, it seems navigation doesn't always break. Open the image for the first time via treeview seems to always break it.

Atom 1.0.2

DISTRIB_ID=LinuxMint
DISTRIB_RELEASE=17.1
DISTRIB_CODENAME=rebecca
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Linux Mint 17.1 Rebecca"

data.title: A bit buggy on Linux Ubuntu Gnome
data.body: The default mouse pointer changes to text insert pointer once I click on Atom. From there it does not allow me to highlight anything. I have Atom also installed on my OS X and it works fine there, just not on this linux.

data.title: Dynamic Grammar
data.body: Is there a way of of defining a dynamic grammar in atom? If there is, this ticket is about improving the documentation. if not it's about implementing a way of doing a dynamic grammar. ### What I mean by dynamic grammar The clearest explanation I found is this screenshot in Scala: where `val` instantiates an immutable variable that is blue and `var` a mutable one that is red. This is not possible just through regular expressions.

data.title: Atom.io fails to run on redhat6.6
data.body:
$ uname -a
Linux MyMachine 2.6.32-504.23.4.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri May 29 10:16:43 EDT 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ cat /etc/redhat-release 
Red Hat Enterprise Linux Workstation release 6.6 (Santiago)

When attempting to install and run the prebuilt binary
$ sudo yum localinstall atom.x86_64.rpm 
Reports that it will install 1.0.2-0.1.fc21 and Completes OK, but running gives the following error
$ atom
/usr/share/atom/atom: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.14' not found (required by /usr/share/atom/atom)
/usr/share/atom/atom: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version`GLIBCXX_3.4.15' not found (required by /usr/share/atom/atom)
/usr/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/share/atom/atom)
/usr/share/atom/atom: /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6: version`GLIBCXX_3.4.15' not found (required by /usr/share/atom/libchromiumcontent.so)
/usr/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/share/atom/libchromiumcontent.so)
/usr/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version`GLIBC_2.14' not found (required by /usr/share/atom/libgcrypt.so.11)
/usr/share/atom/atom: /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.15' not found (required by /usr/share/atom/libgcrypt.so.11)

I'm going to guess that this is due to redhat6 being relatively old, but it's still fully supported by redhat.

data.title: Can't load installed packages or themes on Windows 10
data.body:
Hello! I recently installed atom, and started using it today. Everything seems fine except for loading installed packages/themes and installing from the program.

When I click on install I get an error saying: _Fetching featured packages failed_.

And the output is:

```
spawn C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe;C:\python27 ENOENT
```

And when I open the dev console while looking at the installed packages page I see:

```
Fetching local packages failed. Error: Fetching local packages failed.
  at createProcessError (C:\Users\fredr\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.2\resources\app.asar\node_modules\settings-view\lib\package-manager.js:607:13)
  at C:\Users\fredr\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.2\resources\app.asar\node_modules\settings-view\lib\package-manager.js:618:23
  at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (C:\Users\fredr\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.2\resources\app.asar\node_modules\event-kit\lib\emitter.js:82:11)
  at BufferedProcess.module.exports.BufferedProcess.handleError (C:\Users\fredr\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.2\resources\app.asar\src\buffered-process.js:251:20)
  at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (C:\Users\fredr\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.2\resources\app.asar\src\buffered-process.js:240:24)
  at emitOne (events.js:77:13)
  at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:166:7)
  at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1055:12)
  at child_process.js:1127:20
  at process._tickCallback (node.js:357:13)
```

I am running 64-bit Windows 10 Build 10130.
